entry.title: Aer Lingus Now Serving Platters at the Sky Deli Cafe
entry.content:
So Aer Lingus are now serving platters. At least in peasant class from Madrid to Dublin. And there's only about 13 of us on the plane. Maybe that's why...

They have a fruit platter, a cheese platter, a cracker and pâté platter, a pretentious platter and ... I think I'll have the give-it-a-fancy-name-so-I-don't-realize-it's-soggy-apples-and-pears-and-one-tiny-piece-of-strawberry-in-a-plastic-cup platter. When did things become so silly?

And when did the flight attendants - if that's still politically correct - become so grumpy? Where are the green clad smiley people that fill the in-flight magazine? The great Irish sage Tommy Tiernan once said that Irish people are happiest when we're broke. I guess the crisis hasn't hit Aer Lingus staff... yet.

Wow, €7.60 for a sandwich and a coffee. No sign of the crisis here. Granted, it's a litre and a half of coffee - but €7.60! And my poor... squished... sandwich! It looks like it has been packaged by a frustrated Ryanair passenger... it'll fit... It'll fit... It... will... There! Told ya!.


My favourite bit of this whole adventure however is the name they've given to their little carts of goodies. The Sky Deli Cafe. Mmmmmmmm... magical. Now, if I was none the wiser and someone told me they had just had lunch in the Sky Deli Cafe, images of a chic French patisserie version of Guinness' Gravity Bar suspended from white fluffy clouds would spring to mind, and not the patronising reality of "Now!" ...hands clasped a la Mrs. O' Shea, first class teacher... "Can I getchaz anything from d'Sky Deli Cafe?" ...unstated suffix: and hurry up coz I don't have all day!!! I often order something simply out of fear.

And what of the spife and the DIY or rather the CUAYCINDI* waste bag... Well, you'll just have to hop onboard the next friendly Aer Lingus flight and see for yourself. But, by the gods, make sure you've done your sums and your spelling...


*Clean Up After Yourself Coz I'm Not Doing It.

entry.title: The USA and its UN Vetoes...
entry.content:
"Palestinian leader Mahmoud Abbas has submitted his bid to the UN for recognition of a Palestinian state. Addressing the General Assembly shortly afterwards, he called on the Security Council to approve full Palestinian membership of the UN.He said the Palestinians had entered negotiations with Israel with sincere intentions, but blamed the building of Jewish settlements for their failure.Israel and the US say a Palestinian state can only be achieved through talks with Israel."

BBC News - President Abbas receives ovation at UN.

Tonight, having watched Mahmoud Abbas ask for his people the right to self-determination, and believing with fair certainty that the United States will use its veto to block the motion, I decided to do a little online investigation of the number of times the US has used its veto in the UN. The answer?

Lots! Over 70 since 1972 ...

But while the number in itself is indeed pause for thought (I didn't find a list of how many they'd not vetoed), it was the nature of the resolutions they have blocked that is truly frightening.

The one that stands out to me most is their veto of the UN call for a treaty on children's rights in 2008. Now the lawyers among you may ask if I'm familiar with the particulars of that specific resolution - I am not. But the vote was 159 to 1. Is it conceivable that 159 nations had it wrong and only the US of A had it right?

I've taken this information from a few sites, but mostly here: KryssTal : USA Vetos in the UN. Have a look at what other Global improvements the US has obstructed over the past 4 decades. But as the warning at the top of that website urges:
"Do not simply believe anything on this website - always check for yourself. Treat the stories and quotes in these pages as pointers to find out more. Learn to think for yourself and check all information."

entry.title: Keyboard Zoom Shortcut for Word:Mac
entry.content:
Here's how to add keyboard shortcuts for Microsoft Word's Zoom features in Word:Mac 2011.


  1. In Word: Mac 2011 go to Tools --> Customize Keyboard...

  2. Select the category 'View' on the left.

  3. In the 'Commands' list, scroll down to ViewZoomPageWidth (this is what I mostly use). Select it.

  4. Put your cursor in the box next to 'Press new keyboard shortcut:'.

  5. Press a combination of keys (i.e., your chosen shortcut. I chose Command+Option+=)

  6. If your chosen shortcut it already assigned it will be indicated below following the statement, 'Currently assigned to:'.

  7. Finally, click 'Assign'.

  8. Repeat the same operation for other zoom commands you may need.

  9. Select OK when finished.

If you're a keyboard-fiend, like me, this kind of shortcut assignment(s) can greatly speed-up your workflow. You can do this for any other menu item.
